data: Once upon a time—But what author will venture to begin his tale so now-a-days?—Obsolete! tedious!—Such is the cry of the gentle, or rather ungentle reader, who wishes to be plunged at once, medias in res, according to the wise advice of the old Roman poet.

Once upon a time--But what author will venture to begin his tale so now-a-days?--Obsolete! tedious!--Such is the cry of the gentle, or rather ungentle reader, who wishes to be plunged at once, _medias in res_, according to the wise advice of the old Roman poet.

Once upon a time—But what author will venture to begin his tale so now-a-days?—Obsolete! tedious!—Such is the cry of the gentle, or rather ungentle reader, who wishes to be plunged at once, _medias in res_, according to the wise advice of the old Roman poet.
Specimens of German Romance; Vol. II. Master Flea
E. T. A. (Ernst Theodor Amadeus) Hoffmann
Hoffmann, E. T. A. (Ernst Theodor Amadeus), 1776-1822; Soane, George, 1790-1860 [Editor]
